access_data.csvDesc: Comma-separated values, compatible with Excel and most analysis tools
access_data.desc: Access comprehensive disaster event data for your research, analysis, and reporting needs. Select your preferred time period, locations, and export format to get started.
access_data.dateRange: Choose your data start and end dates. This field is optional.
access_data.info1: CSV files include: event_id, event_type, location, severity, date, description
access_data.info2: JSON files contain structured data with nested metadata and coordinates
access_data.info3: Raw data includes complete event records with all available fields
access_data.info4: Data is updated daily and reflects events from the past 5 years
access_data.filterDesc: Filter data by amount of data, keywords, disaster types, or severity levels to tailor your download to your specific needs. This field is optional.
access_data.jsonDesc: Structured JSON data for programmatic access and API integration
access_data.locDesc: Choose one or more locations to include in your download
access_data.successDownload: âœ“ Download started! Check your downloads folder for the data file.
access_data.title: Download Raw Disaster Data
access_data.zipDesc: Complete raw data dump with all fields and metadata

ChatbotWidget.chat: Hello! How can I help you find disaster information today?
ChatbotWidget.desc: Ask about current or historical disasters by location, time or type
ChatbotWidget.err: Sorry, I'm having trouble connecting to the disaster database. Please try again later.
